name: Design
info:
A fairly common blog-style or content heavy
layout.

```
+-------------------------------------------+
| Title (h1)                                |
| Sub-title (div                            |
| Nav1 Nav2 Nav2 (menu)                     |
+-------------------------------------------+
+ Sidebar + Main (for articles)             |
| (aside) |                                 |
|         | +-----------------------------+ |
|         | | Article title (h2)          | |
|         | +-----------------------------+ |
|         | | Article body                | |
|         | +-----------------------------+ |
|         | +-----------------------------+ |
|         | | Article title (h2)          | |
|         | +-----------------------------+ |
|         | | Article body                | |
|         | +-----------------------------+ |
|         |                                 |
|         +---------------------------------+
|         | Footer                          |
+---------+---------------------------------+
```

Uses a CSS Grid with named grid template areas.
This makes it simple to adjust.

The areas for the layout above are:

```css
grid-template-areas: 
    "header header"
    "sidebar main"
    "sidebar footer";
```

To make the footer full width, use:

```css
grid-template-areas: 
    "header header"
    "sidebar main"
    "footer footer";
```

To move the sidebar to the right, use:

```css
grid-template-areas: 
    "header header"
    "main sidebar"
    "footer sidebar";
```

The example has a breakpoint for narrow
screens (set at 512px) where it switches to
a single column with the sidebar below the 
main area.
